description:
Masane Amaha and her daughter Rihoko are on the run from a government child welfare agency that wants to take Rihoko away from her mother. They are caught and Rihoko is taken away. Meanwhile, Masane is attacked by an advanced weapon that can disguise itself as a human being. When faced with the danger, a strange light emits from her wrist and she transforms into a powerful being. She destroys the weapon and consequently becomes involved in a power struggle between powerful organizations, with her at the center of their attention. Because she holds the greatest power of them all, the legendary Witchblade.

(Source: AniDB)

tags.name: Super Power

tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Natural Disaster
tags.description: It focuses on catastrophic events of natural origin, such as earthquakes, tsunamis,  volcanic eruptions, and severe storms. These works often present situations of extreme danger in which the characters struggle to survive and overcome the adversity.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

node.description:
[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/notomamiko/)

A Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. She is married and has one kid.

**Non-anime roles:**
- Shinano - Azur Lane (VG)
- Emma - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Skirk - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Durandal - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Jun Kazama - Tekken series (VG)
- Mother - Avataro Sentai Donbrothers (Super Sentai) 
- Rella Melancoryphus Cygnus - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Yi Xuan - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

[Website](http://themonicarial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rialisms) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rialisms/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaY5WvG6QScTq6dlRbCbp7Q)

An American voice actress, ADR director, and script writer affiliated with Funimation and Seraphim Digital/Sentai Filmworks.

Monica's father is from Pontevedra, Galicia, Spain, and when she was young, her family would often visit there. She would translate for her younger brother some of the European Spanish-dubbed cartoons which included anime like Doraemon and Dragon Ball Z, often imitating the various characters. Monica studied ballet, tap, and jazz, but transitioned to musical theater when was 12. She studied acting through high school as well as college at the University of Houston. She's cited voice actor inspirations from The Simpsons, Family Guy, and Beavis and Butt-head. She was working on a theater show with Jason Douglas, who suggested she audition for ADV Films. Her first voice-over role was a walla in the 1999 dub of Martian Successor Nadesico.

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

**Birthplace:** Los Angeles, California
**Spouse:** Rachel Robinson (2019-)

[Website](http://www.masa.world/)
She was nicknamed "Yasuko Nyan" by her godfather Naomi Takebe, a producer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).
She was nicknamed "Yasuko Nyan" by her godfather Naomi Takebe, a producer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bbkoichi21)__

[Website](http://psychiclover.net)

Psychic Lover (サイキックラバー) is a J-pop band consisting of vocalist YOFFY (Yoshiyuki Wada / 和田よしゆき) and guitarist [IMAJO](https://anilist.co/staff/357213) (Tatsuhiro Imajo / 今城龍寛). Originally consisting of six members, YOFFY and IMAJO are the only two who remained for their rise to fame. Much of their work has been featured as opening and closing themes of Japanese television series and anime. YOFFY has also worked with Eizo Sakamoto (vocalist of [Anthem](https://anilist.co/staff/191547/) and Animetal), [Masaaki Endou](https://anilist.co/staff/101528/), [Sakura Nogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95204/), [Ai Tokunaga](https://anilist.co/staff/95324), [Ryouko Shintani](https://anilist.co/staff/95315/), [Mayumi Gojou](https://anilist.co/staff/107007/), [Sister MAYO](https://anilist.co/staff/345387/), and [Yukari Fukui](https://anilist.co/staff/95359/) on other projects.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/negiosyo)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/negiosyo)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoohmish)
_Note: Not to be confused with the [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/119169/)._
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西森章)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/e8144) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eunyoung_tokyo)

Eun-Yeong Choi is an animator, director and producer. Since 2020, she is the President and CEO of the animation studio [Science SARU](https://anilist.co/studio/6145/), which she co-founded with [Masaaki Yuasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/) in 2013. A frequent collaborator with Yuasa, she has been involved in all of his projects since _[Kemonozume](https://anilist.co/anime/1454/)_ (2006).

Choi began her career as an animator on shows such as _[Witchblade](https://anilist.co/anime/935/)_, _[Black Lagoon](https://anilist.co/anime/889/)_ and _Kemonozume_ (all 2006). She made her directorial debut in 2008 on episodes of _[Kaiba](https://anilist.co/anime/3701/)_, and later worked as assistant director on _[Kick-Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/16149/)_ (2013). Choi transitioned to producer in 2017, beginning with _[The Night Is Short, Walk On Girl](https://anilist.co/anime/97917/)_. In 2021, she returned to directing, helming an episode of _Star Wars: Visions_.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [writer](https://anilist.co/staff/249891) or the younger [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/283043)._
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chamarusaku)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chamarusaku)
